greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that 2^(2^n) - 2^k - 1 is prime, or 0 if no such k exists.
comment: Crocker showed that 2^(2^n) - 1 - 2^a - 2^b is not prime (with n > 2) if a and b are distinct. This sequence demonstrates that the theorem is sharp in the sense that distinctness is required.
link: Roger Crocker, "On the sum of a prime and of two powers of two", Pacific Journal of Mathematics 36:1 (1971), pp. 103-107.
results.author: _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 26 2013
ext: a(15) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 02 2013
